newsitem.title: USA: U.S. INDUSTRIES SEES 97 OPER SHR $2.15-20.
newsitem.headline: U.S. INDUSTRIES SEES 97 OPER SHR $2.15-20.

text.p: U.S. Industries Inc said Thursday it expects full year earnings per share from continuing operations of $2.15 to $2.20 per share.
The First Call consensus estimate for the year ending September 30 is $2.20 per share.
The company reported third quarter income from continuing operations of $33 million, or $0.66 per share, compared with $19 million, or $0.37 per share, a year earlier.
The First Call consensus for the quarter was $0.62.

Chief Executive Officer David Clarke said, "We are pleased with our overall results for the third quarter, which showed good increases in both operating income and earnings per share. With the announced sale of Odyssey Golf, we have decided to discontinue our remaining golf operations, which will be divested."
Chief Operating Officer John Raos added, "Strong operating results at Ames, Ertl and our lighting operations more than offset weaker economic conditions in Europe at Rexair and Jacuzzi."
Nine month income from continuing operations rose to $77 million, or $1.53 per share, from $47 million, or $0.90 per share, a year earlier.

"Despite the elimination of expected earnings from our golf division and weak trading conditions in certain European markets at Jacuzzi and Rexair, we still anticipate achieving full-year earnings per share from continuing operations in the range of $2.15 to $2.20," Clarke said.
